textbooks.title: Manufacturing of Pharmaceutical Proteins: From Technology to Economy
textbooks.author: Stefan Behme

topics: Fermentation and cell culture â€“ process technology, equipment and controls.
Harvest and clarification of biological products. Centrifugation, microfiltration, depth filtration.
Filtration processes in protein purification. Ultrafiltration, diafiltration, viral clearance, sterilizing filtration.
Auxiliary process operations (media and buffer preparation, dispensing, storage).
Equipment cleaning in modern biotech facilities (Clean-In-Place, Clean-Out of-Place).
Sterilization of Equipment, Piping and Process Fluids (Steam-In-Place, Autoclave Sterilization, Biowaste Treatment)

_metadata.course_description: This course is focused on topics related to the technology, design and operations of modern biopharmaceutical facilities.
learning_outcomes: demonstrate familiarity with technologies, unit operations and GMP requirements for the manufacturing of biopharmaceutical products
analyze and develop manufacturing processes for most common biopharmaceuticals
formulate facility and process equipment requirements for manufacturing of biopharmaceuticals
develop and implement Standard Operating Procedures and other GMP documentation for various manufacturing and support operations
